meanings.definition: to make a mistake in striking or hitting something.
meanings.sent1: She misstrikes the nail and hits her thumb instead.
meanings.sent2: He often misstrikes the ball during baseball practice.
meanings.sent3: The robot misstrikes the target and hits the wall instead.
meanings.sent4: The archer misstrikes the bullseye, landing the arrow just outside the target.
meanings.sent5: The chef misstrikes the cutting board, chopping off a small piece of finger.

meanings.definition: plural form of misstrike, referring to errors in striking or hitting.
meanings.sent1: The misstrikes on the metal surface were visible under the bright light.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully corrected the misstrikes on the canvas before showcasing the painting.
meanings.sent3: The misstrikes in the dance routine added a comedic element to the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was full of misstrikes, but the audience found it endearing.
meanings.sent5: The misstrikes in the musical composition created a unique sound that captivated listeners.
